Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday February 10), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, february 10th. microsoft has announced a groundbreaking partnership with openai to integrate advanced artificial intelligence technology into its suite of products. this collaboration aims to enhance user experience by providing more personalized and efficient tools. the partnership is expected to be a major catalyst for ai adoption across various industries.

amazon is venturing further into healthcare with the launch of its virtual primary care service, amazon care, in 20 additional states. the expansion underscores amazon's commitment to transforming healthcare delivery by leveraging technology to offer convenient and accessible medical services. this move could intensify competition with established healthcare providers.

meanwhile, google faces backlash over changes to its privacy policy aimed at collecting more user data to improve targeted advertising. privacy advocates are raising concerns about the implications for user privacy. google has responded by stating that it offers transparent controls and options for users to manage their data.

shares of electric vehicle maker rivian saw a boost today after the company reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter deliveries. rivian's focus on sustainable vehicle production and its commitment to meeting delivery targets have resonated well with investors. the company plans to ramp up production in the coming months, amid growing demand for electric vehicles.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, february 10. 

microsoft has announced an innovative partnership with openai to bring advanced artificial intelligence technology to its suite of products. the collaboration aims to enhance user experience, offering more personalized and efficient tools. this move is set to be a significant driver for ai adoption across various sectors.

in healthcare news, amazon is expanding its virtual primary care service, amazon care, into 20 additional states. this expansion highlights amazon's commitment to revolutionizing healthcare delivery by leveraging technology to provide convenient and accessible medical services. the move could ramp up competition with traditional healthcare providers.

over to google, the company is facing criticism over recent changes to its privacy policy, which aim to collect more user data for improving targeted advertising. privacy advocates are voicing concerns over potential implications on user privacy. in response, google asserts it offers transparent controls for users to manage their data.

shares of electric vehicle maker rivian surged today following better-than-expected fourth-quarter deliveries. rivian's dedication to sustainable vehicle production and commitment to meeting delivery targets have struck a chord with investors. the company plans to increase production in the coming months amidst growing demand for electric vehicles.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-213 Microsoft & Openai's Ai Expansion 🤝, Amazon's Healthcare Revolution 🏥, Google Faces Privacy Scrutiny 🔒
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, february 10! let's dive into today's top stories in technology and beyond:

  • microsoft & openai partnership: microsoft collaborates with openai to integrate advanced ai technology across its products, aiming to improve user experience with more personalized and efficient tools.
  • amazon care expansion: amazon is set to expand its virtual primary care service into 20 additional states, challenging traditional healthcare providers by offering convenient tech-driven medical services.
  • google privacy policy scrutiny: google faces backlash for its privacy policy changes intended to increase data collection for better-targeted advertising, with privacy advocates voicing concerns.
  • rivian's stock surge: shares of electric vehicle maker rivian rise sharply following strong fourth-quarter deliveries, driven by sustainable production and growing demand.

stay tuned for tomorrow's updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image that features a futuristic cityscape at dusk, blending elements of innovation, healthcare, and technology. in the foreground, holographic representations of interconnected digital networks and neural pathways symbolize microsoft's and openai's ai expansion, weaving seamlessly through the skyline. to the left, a modern hospital building with glowing windows showcases advanced medical technology, representing amazon's healthcare revolution with digital health interfaces and robotic assistants depicted. in the background, a large, intricate digital lock and shield hover above the skyline, symbolizing google's scrutiny over privacy issues. the overall mood is dynamic and forward-looking, with a spectrum of colors reflecting innovation and connectivity, unified in a single, compelling narrative of cutting-edge technology transforming the urban landscape
